txt.en: 'I miss my husband, [placeholder]. Would that he were here! I would give anything for news of Gladsúnu.'
Agelwyn can be found in the refugees' hiding spot north of Marton.\n\nYou should help Agelwyn to put aside her anxiety and begin to lead her people.
Talk to Agelwyn
Agelwyn can be found in the refugees' hiding spot north of Marton.\n\nYou should help Agelwyn to put aside her anxiety and begin to lead her people.
Agelwyn is distraught under the pressure of responsibility that has settled on her shoulders
'You are right, of course. I must lead these people, even if only for my husband's sake.'
Agelwyn can be found in the refugees' hiding spot north of Marton.\n\nYou should help Agelwyn to put aside her anxiety and begin to lead her people.
Listen to Agelwyn
Agelwyn's memory unfolds....
Listen to Agelwyn
Speak with Agelwyn
'I have never been so sad in my life, [placeholder]. I remember our last conversation like it was yesterday.'
Agelwyn can be found in the refugees' hiding spot north of Marton.\n\nYou should help Agelwyn to put aside her anxiety and begin to lead her people.
Agelwyn, the young wife of Thane Gladsúnu of Marton, is reluctant to lead her people in her husband's absence.
Speak with Agelwyn
Listen to Agelwyn
'Now what do I do, [placeholder]? I have not the experience to see what is right. In my heart, though, I wish to do as my beloved Gladsúnu bade me.'

'And here is my predicament: Should I really urge these people to make for Helm's Deep?

'How do I know when that dire time is here? What if I wait too long, or go when I should stay and fight?'

You assure Agelwyn that King Théoden himself has retreated to Helm's Deep, and urges everyone he sees to do the same.
If Agelwyn wishes to heed her husband's advice and make for Helm's Deep, now is the time.
Agelwyn can be found in the refugees' hiding spot north of Marton.\n\nYou should help Agelwyn to put aside her anxiety and begin to lead her people.
Agelwyn can be found in the refugees' hiding spot north of Marton.\n\nYou should help Agelwyn to put aside her anxiety and begin to lead her people.
Instance: A Reluctant Young Leader
